span: Panel A has two red triangles, three green, two blue. B has four green, one blue. Panel C has three blue, three green. Panel D has four blue, one green, no star. Panel E has three green, two blue, and one red. Panel F has three green, three blue, two red and a star.
summary: Lists color counts for all panels

span: So panel A, panel E and panel F, they all have red.
summary: Notes A, E, F contain red triangles

span: Panel B, panel C, panel D do not have red.
summary: Notes B, C, D lack red triangles

span: Panel A has two green upright. Panel F has two green upright. Panel E has one.

span: (4.0) They all have three green, also. Each has three green triangles and a red.
summary: Observes every starred panel has three green and red

span: That seems to be all I can muster.
summary: Expresses difficulty finding more features

span: Uh..two red, one red, two red.

span: Panel A, two red, has a all three colors. Panel E has all three colors. Panel F has all three colors.
summary: Observes these panels include all three colors

span: They also have a green standing.
summary: Notes presence of upright green triangle

span: They also have blue on top of green, but so does panel B and panel C, so that doesn't count.
summary: Rejects blue-on-green feature as non-distinctive

span: (3.0) So... a green standing or three green...three green triangles and a red.
summary: Proposes candidate rules: green standing or 3 green+red

span: I believe all three colors is the most obvious.
summary: Prefers rule based on having all three colors

span: I will go with three [TYPING] Three... three red triangles... Sorry...All three colors in each panel.
summary: Commits to rule: each panel has all three colors

span: Um... Three green triangles per panel.

span: A has a star, panel A. Two blue, two green, one red. Panel B has a star, two red, two green, one blue. Panel C, one red, one blue, two green to red. Panel D two red, two green, one blue. Panel E, three green, two blue. Panel F, two blue, two red, one green.

span: There's three...four triangles upright in A. Four...five in B and three in E. But there's four in C and four..three in D and there's no star.

span: So I believe it is... (17.0)  I'm not sure actually. This is quite difficult.

span: I think the fact that E has three greens, B has two greens, A has two greens...
summary: Highlights differing green counts in starred panels

span: Is it to do with the blue? No, it's not to do with the blue. It's not to do with the red either.
summary: Rules out blue or red involvement

span: What has it got in common. B? B has two red standing. A has one red standing. E has no red standing, so that's irrelevant.

span: So maybe it's more than one standing.

span: Let's put that. [TYPING] Must have more than one... have at least two green standing triangles.

span: Um.  (6.0) What else? ...two green.

span: A has two blue on its side, one red – two red, one green, with a star. Panel B has blue on side, red on side, overlapping green and blue, and one green. C has a star, two greens overlapping, two blues on side. (3.5) Panel D has two greens, two blues and a red, one green on side. Panel E has one blue on side, three greens, two reds with them overlapping, green and red. Panel F has a star and it has two blues on side, one red on side, one red slanted, one green on side.
